items.title: This deal on ASUS’ AMD-powered ultra-thin Vivobook 16 Copilot+ PC is too good to pass up at $420 off
items.summary:
As part of its wider 3-day Mega Deal Zone sale event, B&H is offering ASUS’ Vivobook 16 AMD-powered Copilot+ PC in Cool Silver finish for $479.99 shipped. This 16GB RAM/1TB SSD configuration usually sells for around $900, but today’s deal delivers a straight-up 40% markdown, shaving $420 off its usual going rate. That makes it cheaper than its own 14-inch counterpart, which is currently listed at $750 at Amazon. It’s a pretty good option to consider if you’re looking to pick up a Copilot+ laptop for a good price, and you can learn more about it below.

items.title: Tested: Baseus’ 245W Nomos 6-in-1 charging station is a capable desktop charger that can do it all
items.summary:
There’s no shortage of multi-device charging stations out there, but most force you to choose between wireless charging or USB-C ports for wired accessories like, say, a MacBook or an iPad. You usually get one or the other, which is a mildly annoying inconvenience Baseus is trying to resolve this with its new 245W Nomos charging station which we’re checking out today. This model packs two retractable cables, four USB-C ports, two USB-A ports, and a 15W Qi2 wireless charging pad. It’s touted to be an ultimate all-in-one solution for your desk, but does it actually deliver? I’ve been using it as my main desktop charging station for the past few weeks to see how it holds up, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

more…

items.title: Upgrade doors with Anker’s palm vein recognition eufy Matter smart locks from $180 Amazon lows
items.summary:
By way of its official eufy Amazon storefront, Anker is offering returning low prices on three of its popular smart locks – all with palm vein recognition. Things start with the base FamiLock E34 Smart Lock at $179.98 shipped, matching the direct website pricing, while the more advanced FamiLock S3 Smart Lock is down at $229.48 shipped (matching its direct pricing), and the most advanced FamiLock S3 Max Smart Lock at $279.98 shipped (matching its direct pricing). These three models usually go for $280, $350, and $400 at full price, respectively, which we last saw drop to these all-time low prices back during Christmas sales, while we also saw some shorter-term dips to these rates in early January. Now, you’re getting the first shot to grab them at their best prices in 2026, saving you $100 or $120 off the going rates.

more…
